summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an unnamed recipient to appear before the grand jury on August 20, 2019, and produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein. The subpoena includes an attached advice of rights and detailed instructions for document production.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands production of all materials relating to him, indicating he is the central subject of the grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena to gather evidence for a grand jury investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The unnamed subpoena recipient is commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce evidence.

events.title: Subpoena Issued

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York, Southern District of New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on August 15, 2019, for an appearance on August 20, 2019, indicating active federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein at that time.
The subpoena demands production of 'all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein,' including text messages, emails, social media, documents, and notes, showing a broad evidence-gathering scope.
The subpoena explicitly covers materials stored electronically anywhere, including on foreign servers, indicating an effort to obtain international evidence.
The legal statutes cited (18 U.S.C. §§ 371, 1001, 1519) relate to conspiracy, false statements, and destruction of evidence, suggesting the investigation's potential focus.
The recipient of the subpoena is not named in the provided text, indicating this document is likely a template or the recipient's name is on a separate page.
